A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie had some amazing scenes and was gorgeous throughout. Luke Skywalker has forever had his character scarred (to the point that I don't play as him as much in videogames) and I feel that this movie has done damage to the franchise in general.

The movie has many pointless and forgettable characters and moments and tries too hard to be in your face funny\, which really doesn't suit the Star Wars aesthetic. This movie is frustrating because it has some of the most amazing scenes\, set pieces and senses of scale\, but at nearly every opportunity the potential is squandered and is anticlimactic. For every utterly incredible moment (there are several\, and they feel magically of the true essence of Star Wars)\, there is one awful\, pointless or cringey moment to shoot the amazing one down.

 There was so much potential\, but this movie has overpowered\, pointless and forgettable characters for the sake of filling archetypes. What I really want is a Star Wars STORY\, weaved together with intrigue and intent. Instead I got Star Wars moments\, taped together with drawn out sequences that don't really make sense and don't add depth to the characters that I care about.

In short\, beautiful to look at\, with some amazing parts but just a crying shame that some decisions were made.

Luke Skywalker deserved better.
